def_en: Magic is the power to use supernatural forces to make impossible things happen, such as making people disappear or controlling events in nature.

You can use magic when you are referring to an event that is so wonderful, strange, or unexpected that it seems as if supernatural powers have caused it. You can also say that something happens as if by magic or like magic .

def_cn: (似)用魔法变成的;(似)用魔术变出的
def_en: You use magic to describe something that does things, or appears to do things, by magic.
Magic is the art and skill of performing mysterious tricks to entertain people, for example by making things appear and disappear.
If you refer to the magic of something, you mean that it has a special mysterious quality which makes it seem wonderful and exciting to you and which makes you feel happy.

def_cn: （令人钦佩的）特殊才能，能力
def_en: If you refer to a person's magic, you mean a special talent or ability that they have, which you admire or consider very impressive.

def_cn: （数目、词语等）重要的，关键的，举足轻重的
def_en: You can use expressions such as the magic number and the magic word to indicate that a number or word is the one which is significant or desirable in a particular situation.

def_cn: 立见奇效的;立竿见影的
def_en: Magic is used in expressions such as there is no magic formula and there is no magic solution to say that someone will have to make an effort to solve a problem, because it will not solve itself.

def_cn: 极好的;了不起的;非常棒的
def_en: If you say that something is magic, you think it is very good or enjoyable.
